WorkItem.Description:
Hi,
 
I added a comment to issue 1271, but thought that it might be missed.
 
I am seeing the same issue as reported in issue 1271 even though I am using the latest changeset 17937. Here is the error:
 
Unhandled Exception: OopFactory.X12.Parsing.Model.TransactionValidationException: Segment 'QTY*QC*1' in position 18 within tr
ansaction '000000001' cannot be identified within the supplied specification for transaction set 277.
Parameter name: 277
 at OopFactory.X12.Parsing.X12Parser.ParseMultiple(Stream stream, Encoding encoding) in C:\Users\spasha.SENCOSYSTEMS\Docume
nts\Proj\Heater\ANSI\ANSI 5010\X12Parser\x12parser-17937\trunk\src\OopFactory.X12\Parsing\X12Parser.cs:line 196
 at OopFactory.X12.X12Parser.Program.Main(String[] args) in C:\Users\spasha.SENCOSYSTEMS\Documents\Proj\Heater\ANSI\ANSI 50
10\X12Parser\x12parser-17937\trunk\src\OopFactory.X12.X12Parser\Program.cs:line 27
 
I also attached the 277 CA file. This test file was generated by Emdeon (a clearinghouse for 837 transmissions).
 
Thank you in advance.
 
Regards,
Steve

Comments.Message:
This is a slightly different issue than 1271, the 1271 caused an error because there was a missing segment in the specification.

I believe this is an error in the validity of your x12:

In the case of of Embdeon.txt file, I think your X12 is missing a TRN segment:
If you look at the lines were the error is occurring:

ST*277*000000001*005010X214~
BHT*0085*08*000000001*20120725*0102*TH~
HL*1**20*1~
NM1*AY*2*EMDEON*****46*133052274~
TRN*1*EPNCEKN000HC669~
DTP*050*D8*20120725~
DTP*009*D8*20120725~
HL*2*1*21*1~
NM1*41*2*TEST COMPANY*****46*680001999~
TRN*2*0001~
STC*A1:19:AY*20120725*WQ*3350~
QTY*AA*1~
AMT*YY*770~
HL*3*2*19*1~
NM1*85*2*TEST, INC (STEVE)*****XX*1528154507~
REF*TJ*999999345~
QTY*QC*1~
AMT*YY*770~

Your HL*3 loop (LoopId=2000C from spec) does not have a TRN Segment (LoopId=2200C from spec) preceding the REF, QTY, and AMT segments, this is why the parser is failing to place the QTY segment.

If you think the HL*3 loop above is correct, then let me know what loop the REF, QTY and AMT belong to and I will update the spec.
